title: 'They tried to erase our history': Sudan's national heritage is threatened by war
subhead: 'War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation' (5/6)  When the country's museum collections fell into the Rapid Support Forces' hands, they became a real weapon in the conflict with the regular army. Some say the aim is to erase and replace Sudanese identity.

title: Iran's regime faces combined pressure from street protests, Israel and US
French judges alarmed by rumors of potential US sanctions
US immigration officer kills woman in Minneapolis
subhead: An officer shot and killed a woman whom US officials accused of trying to run over ICE agents with her vehicle. The city's mayor has called that claim 'bullshit' and demanded that federal immigration agents leave the city.

title: In Gaza, the war is creating a new generation of deaf children
subhead: According to a survey by a local non-profit organization, 35,000 children and adults have partially or completely lost their hearing during the two years of war that followed the Hamas attack in October 2023.

title: Semyon Bychkov appointed music director of the Opéra national de Paris
subhead: The American-naturalized conductor, aged 73, is succeeding Gustavo Dudamel, who resigned in May 2023.

title: 'If Doctors Without Borders were to cease activities in Gaza, the impact would be absolutely enormous'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, Filipe Ribeiro, head of mission for Doctors Without Borders in Jerusalem, responds to the Israeli government's decision to ban it and 36 other non-governmental organizations from operating in the occupied Palestinian territories.

title: Venezuela: How the US spent months preparing the military operation to capture Maduro

President Trump withdraws United States from UN Climate Treaty
US will control Venezuelan oil sales 'indefinitely,' energy secretary says
'Whoever controls Greenland influences a key area of European security policy'
Maduro Kidnapping: 'There is a tragic irony in seeing Donald Trump cast himself as Venezuela's liberator'
Trump plots offer to buy Greenland as NATO ally Denmark seethes
Under Trump, the feats of the US military regularly run into the great void of the 'day after'
In Paris, Ukraine's allies express hopes and fears over US security guarantees
Greenland: Europe rejects US threats over sovereignty but finds options limited
Europe yet to give 'clear, unequivocal answer' on Ukraine defense, Zelensky says
'If tomorrow, the US decides to seize Greenland, neither Denmark nor the EU has the means to stop it'
subhead: Donald Trump's military operation in Venezuela should show Europeans that the US is a predator for Europe, just like Russia and China, argues former United Nations under-secretary-general Jean-Marie Guéhenno.

title: Maduro, the failed heir to Hugo Chavez's Bolivarian Revolution
subhead: The Venezuelan president, recently abducted by the US, was chosen by Hugo Chavez as his successor and narrowly elected in 2013. Over 13 years in power, he has eliminated political opposition, tightened control over state institutions and overseen a 70% collapse in GDP as a quarter of Venezuelans fled the country.

title: From Orban to Farage, Europe's far right is unsettled by Trump's new imperialism
subhead: The US operation in Venezuela has forced European nationalists to confront their own contradictions as politicians from countries that carry little weight compared to Russia, China and the United States.

title: EU-Mercosur deal: France's diplomatic gamble falls short
Greenland is and must remain European
'Trump and Putin share a common enemy, liberal Europe, but they have two divergent strategic projects'
